column4: When I plug in a USB pen drive, it is not automounted nor do I have any /dev/sda*. I'm using 6.06 LTS. Any ideas?
/dev/sdb*?
when I do /dev/s (tab) it only shows shm and snd. No sdb.
are you sure it's plugged in and turned on if it needs to be?
yes it's plugged into Bus 003 when I use lsusb. And it's USB powered, the light is on.
any ideas?
well, plug it in again and then dmesg to see what it's doing
[4295458.153000]  usb-storage: device found at 5 .. [4295458.153000]  usb-storage: waiting for device to settle before scanning
nothing else, now?
http://dawley.me.uk/dmesg
well, there you go, it should be /dev/sda1
but it isn't! Even when I'm root it still has no sda
are you sure? sudo ls /dev/sda* ?
why oh why does ls bring it up but normal browsing does not? Oh well
is there a quick way to mount it now?
err, so it was brought up?
I thought you said it wasn't :P
anyhow, see if it's not already mounted in /media
no it isn't in /media
then mount it... sudo mkdir /media/usb && sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/usb -t vfat
thanks a bunch
